intro: Coccinia loureiroana, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit is a round, green berry that turns red when ripe. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
